|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I love the quote you used in your Philosphy of Education. I feel that involving students in the learning process is the only true way that they will learn the material. They may be able to grasp the concept for the day of the test by simply being lectured, but our goals as teachers should be to want them to use that information years down the line. Also, I do agree that it is very important that education is equal across the board. Though not always easy, students should be given the same opportunity for education despite their background! [[User:Tduri002|Tduri002]] ([[User talk:Tduri002|talk]]) 00:13, 12 September 2008 (UTC) Hey Safia! I also like the quote you used, and agree with it completely. Tduri pretty much said what I was going to say, but to elaborate, would you consider using projects and activities to involve your students, to supplement your lectures and slides? And your page looks pretty fancy! Is that your favorite color? [[User:Dbrod001|Dbrod001]] ([[User talk:Dbrod001|talk]]) 19:23, 12 September 2008 (UTC) Actually I'm from the Philippines. ;) [[User:Dbrod001|Dbrod001]] ([[User talk:Dbrod001|talk]]) 21:53, 13 September 2008 (UTC) == [[:Image:Nanosafia.jpg]] is missing a [[Wikibooks:Media#Non-free use|fair use rationale]]== {{mbox|type=warning|msg= '''Thanks for uploading [[:Image:Nanosafia.jpg]].''' The [[w:Wikimedia Foundation|Wikimedia Foundation]] is very careful about what Wikibooks includes because of [[w:United States copyright law|copyright law]], and requires that we maintain a strict [[Wikibooks:Copyright|copyright policy]]. [[:Image:Nanosafia.jpg]] and other files you uploaded may soon be deleted unless a [[Wikibooks:Media#Non-free use|rationale]] for a fair use claim is provided. In order to upload fair use material, specific rationale must be provided as to why fair use media is necessary, and how there are no free alternatives. Images or other media that do not have such rationale will likely be deleted as a copyright violation. If the information of a fair use media component could be duplicated by a free alternative, that media may not be uploaded. Please edit image descriptions pages directly to add {{tlx|fair use rationale}}; there's no need to upload the image again. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me, or [[WB:HELP|ask another Wikibookian]]. See {{UserImages2}} for a complete list of your uploads which may get deleted soon.
Thank you.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 02:45, 9 October 2008 (UTC)}} :[[:Image:Kids-parent.gif]] too  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 02:47, 9 October 2008 (UTC) :And [[:Image:Digitalbaby.jpg]] and [[:Image:Chalkboardsafia.jpg]].  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 02:52, 9 October 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hello! I agree with you that if you are willed enough you are able to teach the student anything. I guess you also have to be able to make it interesting enough for the student, right? So that the student will want to learn. Are you liking your transfer? I am in the NOVA campus. What grade do you want to teach? What made you want to teach? You had some great info :o) [[User:Mmcna012|Mmcna012]] ([[User talk:Mmcna012|talk]]) 18:58, 13 September 2008 (UTC) ==Hello== I like the two words you use to describe teaching: patience and compassion. I think that when a teacher is confronting disciplinary situations or special education issues(some of them really hard) it is very important to exercise both qualities. This enables teachers not to give up on some of the students that need to be helped the most. [[User:Ronei007|Ronei007]] ([[User talk:Ronei007|talk]]) 00:25, 15 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hey Rebecca, First of all I agree with what you said on my page about private schools not really being full of wealthier kids. I just don't beleive in giving some students an edge over others, which I feel private schools do. Aside from that I agree with your philosophy on education. All students should be given the chance to learn no matter what. The technology aspect is also true; with the world beginning to revolve around technology it is important that students are around it from the beginning of the education. However, I think some of the more classic methods should still be used, and calculators are one thing in particular I wish weren't used so much in secondary education since we do not get the opportunity to use them in college. The only thing I would have to disagree with you on though is the whole Redskins thing, personally Steelers are better. Christina [[User:Cpenr002|Cpenr002]] ([[User talk:Cpenr002|talk]]) 19:22, 12 September 2008 (UTC) Hey Rebecca! Thanks for commenting on my page! I agree with your teaching philosophy, especially the bit about all students being equal. And you're a sports fanatic, that's awesome! Are you going to watch any ODU basketball games this season (hopefully they'll do better than last year)? But, like the person above me, I would also have to disagree with you when it comes to the NFL. I personally love the Raiders, despite their spectacular losing streaks. :) Congrats on winning a National event in rowing, though! Best wishes! [[User:Dbrod001|Dbrod001]] ([[User talk:Dbrod001|talk]]) 21:58, 13 September 2008 (UTC) == Copyright problems with [[:Image:Beca-and-Sophie.gif|Image:Beca-and-Sophie.gif]] == {{mbox|type=warning|msg= Thank you for uploading [[:Image:Beca-and-Sophie.gif|Image:Beca-and-Sophie.gif]]. However it is missing information needed for compliance with [[w:copyright|copyright law]] and Wikibooks' [[WB:MEDIA|media policy]]. This and other files you have uploaded may soon be deleted unless the '''copyright permissions''' and '''source''' can be determined. If you know this information, then please add the correct [[WB:ICT|templates]] to the [[:Image:Image:Beca-and-Sophie.gif|description page]] with the copyright and source information included; there is no need to upload it again. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me, or ask in the [[WB:HELP|assistance reading room]]. See {{UserImages}} for a complete list of your uploads which may get deleted soon.
Thank you.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 18:42, 17 October 2008 (UTC)}}

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hi Morgan. I really enjoyed reading your philosophy on education. I found certain things you wrote in your philosophy very interesting such as, that you picture your classroom to be an open, engaging atmosphere were the students can freely ask questions and that schools have the responsibility of instilling knowledge and skills fro students to be productive human beings. Along with these I found other insightful statements very useful. I did want to ask about the elementary school that you attended. Where was the school, and the name of the school? Do you know why they did the separation? What were other benefits from the school doing this? If you would like to respond to these questions that would be great, but I understand if you do not have the time. Kimberley[[User:Kridg002|Kridg002]] ([[User talk:Kridg002|talk]]) 21:14, 13 September 2008 (UTC) Wow :) Morgan, I found it interesting to hear first hand your thoughts on all girls/boys schools.I have never attended one, only public and can express that I agree opposite sex can be a distraction within the classroom during early adolesence years. Looking at the issues that students' face today such as pre-martial sex, and early teen pregnancy it has become a moral delimma for school districts nationwide to separarte the sexes. Separation may be a posative solution to keep students mind set focused on their education and school work. There are enough outside preassures and influences in the world today. Maybe it is more of a ethical issue that should be addressed within the family home, than decided by school districts and state regulators? Whatever conflicts that can be resolved without posing a threat to civil liberties as well as establishing better learning environments for students i support. Good luck to you in your endevours... [[User:Rherr008|Rherr008]] ([[User talk:Rherr008|talk]]) 23:13, 14 September 2008 (UTC) Morgan, Your background both in education and in your interests strike me as ideal for your pursuit as a teacher. Like the previous person to respond to this page, I think that separation of sexes in the classroom has many positive attributes. Lessening the natural attractions between boys and girls and the distractions that go along with that can help to focus young people on the task at hand, namely LEARNING. I have fortunately had the experience of both public and private school education and can attest that the private school was bit better in terms of academics. I also like your perspectives on openness to a wide number of interests like the arts and extra curricular activities. It is important that children learn not only the basic studies together but learn the skills of cooperation and teamwork outside of the classroom. I wish the you best in your pursuit to become a teacher![[User:Efari002|Ed Farinholt (efari002)]] ([[User talk:Efari002|talk]]) 13:36, 28 October 2008 (UTC)

Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} [[User:Jwimb003|Jwimb003]] ([[User talk:Jwimb003|talk]]) 01:06, 12 September 2008 (UTC)Hello, I agree that children need to know you care. They also need to know of your expectation of them. Teachers wear many hats and we must be aware of that as educators. This article on feedback was quite insightful and an interesting read. The use of examples of different assessment types and their relative merit showed clearly the importance of keeping communication open and honest with children during the entire teacher and student relationship. I was particularly struck by the episode you had in college with the question about a re'sume.' I remember similar feelings of bias and lack of openness to my ideas during class in a Money and Banking class I took. As a result, I did not do as well as I hoped I would because I felt intimidated to ask basic questions. I also found the questions challenging and effectively brought home many of the points made in the article. [[User:Efari002|Ed Farinholt (efari002)]] ([[User talk:Efari002|talk]]) 04:05, 16 November 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hello, Katlyn. I loved your About Me article. I give you props for working with the ages of 12-18. I love teaching all ages but elementary is my true passion. I agree with your statement about one teacher making a difference because that is where my passion came from as well. One of my elementary teachers refused to give up on me. She came in early or stayed late to help those who were in need. Your paper was well organized and I liked how you spoke of your recent experiences, motivation, and how you plan to become an effective teacher. I am a believer of no matter what grade level you teach, all teachers can make a difference. Great job and good luck with tutoring the 12-18 year olds. [[User:Ttayl048|Ttayl048]] ([[User talk:Ttayl048|talk]]) 21:36, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I don't know where to begin! Your life story was enough to keep me reading and reading and reading! You have the same career goals as I do, and that is also exciting to me. I really like how you separated the words "fun" and "enjoyable." I completely agree that one thing that we, as educators should teach is how students should be able to change their situations if they so desire. Reality is life is definetly not fun at all time, but any situation can be enjoyable if we choose to make it! Lastly, I would much appreciate help in finding out how to make my page as exciting as yours through use of colors! You did a great job on this page! [[User:Tduri002|Tduri002]] ([[User talk:Tduri002|talk]]) 00:25, 12 September 2008 (UTC) First let me say WOW!!! What a wonderful page!!! I have not gotten that sophisticated with wiki yet. I am amazed at all the traveling you have done. I hope to get some more states under my belt before too long. So far, its only been the Atlantic side of the US for me. I agree as well with the fun and enjoyable concept. I have enjoyed looking/reading your page and will see you soon in class. Kristin [[User:Kgors001|Kgors001]] ([[User talk:Kgors001|talk]]) 20:09, 13 September 2008 (UTC)kgors001 Mimi, you have done an excellent job with your page!! Hopefully one day I will be able to say that I have traveled as much as you. I really like how you emphasized that each student is different and learns at a different pace. This is exactly how I feel. When a teacher can connect with his/her students and make learning an enjoyable experience everybody wins. I also agree with you that respect is not automatic, it must be earned. When a teacher can foster an environment with mutual respect and enjoyable learning experiences, that teachers is successful. Heidi [[User:Hlame001|Hlame001]] ([[User talk:Hlame001|talk]]) 13:09, 14 September 2008 (UTC) WOW I've got to say I am a bit jealous you have traveled so many places; I've gotten the opportunity to travel on two occassions & it opened my eyes to many different cultures! I also LOVED your teaching philosophy, I think you have a lot of worldly knowledge & you incorperate it into all aspects of your life. It was wonderful to read about how connected you are to your family they must be a big part of your life, and really supportive of you. :) [[User:Hpoer001|Hpoer001]] ([[User talk:Hpoer001|talk]]) 02:17, 15 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hi there, nice to meet you. I have a similar outlook on education; like you I have had a bunch of great teachers in my prospective field. I plan to take inspiration from how they taught me and translate that into my own teaching style. [[User:Clins002|Clins002]] ([[User talk:Clins002|talk]]) 16:16, 14 September 2008 (UTC) Hey Clair, I think it is awesome that you are becoming a math teacher! We need more female math and science teachers who can be good role models for female students. I am too thinking of becoming a math teacher or a science teacher. I agree with your teaching philosophy about how it is important that that teacher needs to be enthusiatic about the subject they are teaching. I remember having a few teachers who did not enjoy teaching their subject, so not many students were not motivated about the class. Good Luck Clair!! |- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hi Tim I agree completely with the need to challenge ALL students. So often the system today seems dummyed down and yet chilren who are asked to rise to a challenge so very often EXCEED our expectations! [[User:Pkenn005|Pkenn005]] ([[User talk:Pkenn005|talk]]) 18:21, 11 September 2008 (UTC) Hi, It is always great to challenge your stuents . One thing that stuck me in your philosophy of education is the fact that you plan to lecture. Lecturing is great but even high school kids gets bored with the teacher doing all of the talking. Think about possibly having the kids work in groups or doing a type of lesson that can remove some of the burden off of you as the teacher. You will get tired of talking after lecturing 3-4 bells a day. That way the students can take a more active role in their success and you won't have dry mouth! :) [[User:Ssmit099|Ssmit099]] ([[User talk:Ssmit099|talk]]) 21:37, 14 September 2008 (UTC)ssmit099 Hey Tim, I absolutely agree with the idea of having your students think "outside of the box". I really like your idea about having an open line of communication with your students and parents. If you get to know your students, then I feel you can better adapt to their needs and abilities. Good luck and keep on bowling! [[User:Ckest001|Ckest001]] ([[User talk:Ckest001|talk]]) 22:47, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Casey, I am glad that our teaching philosophies are so similar. If the student comes out of your class feeling good about having learned something you have succeded. With your cheery smile and good attitude you will be an inspirational teacher. Sometimes I think people just pick a career to get everyone off their back, where they should pick something that would make them happy. I am glad that we have met in person as well as online. You are a nice person and you have so much to give. Keep smiling and always remember a nice word goes a long way. Have fun and good luck to you. Whatever school you teach at will certainly have a great asset to their staff.[[Special:Contributions/98.166.0.220|98.166.0.220]] [[User:Pbrit001|Pbrit001]] ([[User talk:Pbrit001|talk]]) 20:33, 13 September 2008 (UTC) Hello Casey, I also have just started my teaching program at ODU. I agree with you completely about the subjects you listed being necessary for school. I am actually an Art Education major, and I strongly believe that art is an important, interactive part of developing independent thought and expression. [[User:Jyaeg001|Jyaeg001]] ([[User talk:Jyaeg001|talk]]) 17:23, 13 September 2008 (UTC) Hey Casey, I really agree with your teaching philosophy. I too believe that it is important to encourage students to engaged in independent thinking because it will help them in the real world. I also agree that is important that students are interacting with other students. That is really cool that you graduated with a Biology degree. Are you planning to teach Biology? Good Luck! [[User:Dkirs003|Dkirs003]] ([[User talk:Dkirs003|talk]]) 23:43, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hello! Your picture looks very exciting! One day I will have enough courage to try it! Your educational philosophy is very insightful. [[User:Scopp001|Scopp001]] ([[User talk:Scopp001|talk]]) 01:07, 13 September 2008 (UTC) Well hello Kelly! Nice pic, but next time you might want to use the snorkel so you dont have to hold your breath! ; ) I think you have some very interesting ideas for your educational philosophy. It would be interesting to see if your theory on breaking the groups into strong, average, and weak links is truly beneficial to all three?! Being empathetic/curtious to others in the classroom is also very important and hopefully your students will take these virtues with them outside the classroom. Anyways, seems like you are on your way to a successful teaching experience. Good luck to you! Gage[[Special:Contributions/70.161.55.43|70.161.55.43]] ([[User talk:70.161.55.43|talk]]) 15:23, 13 September 2008 (UTC)[[User:Gkapp001|Gkapp001]] ([[User talk:Gkapp001|talk]]) 15:28, 13 September 2008 (UTC) Hey Kelly, I also went snorkeling in the Bahamas this summer! As for your philosophy, I totally agree with inclusion in the classroom. I like how you explain about grouping students based on their current level. To me that will prevent the "exceptional student" from becoming bored and allow the "below average student" to have more 1 on 1 help. Overall I really liked the layout of your page and loved your ideas. Good luck in all you do! [[User:Ckest001|Ckest001]] ([[User talk:Ckest001|talk]]) 22:38, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I absolutely agree with your philosophy of education. It is of the upmost importance to emphasize the strenghs of struggling students instead of the weaknesses. Vocational training is a great outlet for students that seem to be struggling academically because it offers students the chance to engage in "real-world" job training. Just because certain children may not have the skill-sets to become English Literature majors at prestigious universities does not mean that they cannot contribute to their society. Why can't we direct students towards vocational programs that teach mechanical skills, woodworking skills, construction management skills, etc? It seems that tailoring an education to the potential interests of a child might be a good idea. [[User:Bisaa002|Bisaa002]] ([[User talk:Bisaa002|talk]]) 00:01, 15 September 2008 (UTC) I'm glad to hear that you are a believer and have been baptized! I have been a Christian for many years and has been the one thing that has been steady in my life. It is the only thing that I know will be there to back me up when I fall. I also agree with you philosophy on education. I completely agree that SOLs are a waste of time and that teaching should not be geared towards a particular standard but things that students can actually use throughout their lifetime. [[User:Jmill137|Jmill137]] ([[User talk:Jmill137|talk]]) 02:44, 15 September 2008 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Efari002!
Ed, I just wanted to say that you are not the only one switching careers to teaching later in life. I have been a stay-at-home mom for several years, but have a degree in International Studies. Two years ago, I taught at a local preschool and discovered a love for teaching I didn't know I had. I like the layout of your page; it shows you have put a lot of effort and thought into your philosophy of education.[[User:Jbrow146|Jbrow146]] ([[User talk:Jbrow146|talk]]) 23:42, 13 September 2008 (UTC) I really enjoyed reading your page. If I had not read about your previous job, after reading your philosophy I would think you have been a teacher all of your life. I agree with your discipline techniques and your teaching methods. [[User:BCollier|BCollier]] ([[User talk:BCollier|talk]]) 01:38, 15 September 2008 (UTC)

==Teaching philosophy== I agree with your views on wasting so much money on programs such as the SOL's and No Child Left Behind. What I hope to accomplish when I become a teacher is to teach the students what they need to know for "real" life. I just hope that in the future schools will see that they need to budget their funds better and apply the money to useful programs. [[User:Kutla001|Kutla001]] ([[User talk:Kutla001|talk]]) 03:10, 10 September 2008 (UTC)
Nice to meet you William. I too have experienced what seems like a teacher "burn-out" over the SOLs, and it is unfortunate. It sounds like you have the right idea and approach to teaching. I think that you would bring a great deal of insight and life experience to your classroom. I agree with you also about technology. I was originally a computer programming student, back ages ago before the Internet and agree that integrating technology into the classroom is crucial. You make a great point about learning and being well rounded. To much focus is on the SOL mandatory quota. I enjoyed reading your page. [[User:Myanc004|Myanc004]] ([[User talk:Myanc004|talk]]) 03:08, 14 September 2008 (UTC)
Hello, William! It was relieving to hear from someone else who is able and willing to identify the obvious lack of warmth felt for the students and their schools by the very ones who currently teach! I, too, feel that children deserve better than this; having summers off is not a good reason to stay in the profession of teaching. My hope and prayer is that these people are only making light of difficult situations and that they really do sustain a true passion for children's learning. Anyway, it's great to hear that someone like you is truly interested in changing the face of today's system for the sake of all of our children. Good luck and thank you![[User:Riddle00579942marie|Riddle00579942marie]] ([[User talk:Riddle00579942marie|talk]]) 18:47, 20 September 2008 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Bcowen!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |

Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything & it is really easy. Come say [[WB:HELP|hello]] to everyone!

Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. |- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I really like your quotes, and I like how you say how kids should be able to think freely. Anyone would read this, it is so interesting with your pictures and fun facts about your "free time". I guess the only thing is how it shows your politcal side-- which if this was a page that parents and faculty were looking at, would you really want them to know? But I guess its up to you :o)Its really great! [[User:Mmcna012|Mmcna012]] ([[User talk:Mmcna012|talk]]) 18:50, 13 September 2008 (UTC) ==love it== love your user page. what other festivals did you work this summer? will get you posted on the about the author list right now. have a good one. [[User:PbakerODU|Pete]] ([[User talk:PbakerODU|talk]]) 18:54, 12 September 2008 (UTC) ==moved from front page== I completely agree with your philosophy and what you wish to accomplish as a future educator. We all need to try to find that spark in eachother's students and help the student find their passion in life or school. The job of an educator is not to just get information across, but try to reveal to the student what his or her passion is. Your pictures I also find to be quite amusing. [[User:Jdigg009|Jdigg009]] ([[User talk:Jdigg009|talk]]) 02:38, 14 September 2008 (UTC) Hello Bcowen. I enjoyed your pictures and reading your page. I have experienced both types of teaching throughout the years that my children have attended school, free thought and fact based teaching. I think you show a great deal of exuberance that you can bring to the classroom, and I think that you will have a wonderful means of understanding and involving kinetic learners that often have difficulty in class. Dont give up faith in the public classrooms; you are exactly what they need. It may be a little more hard work on your part, but you can always work in your own style of teaching into your class. [[User:Myanc004|Myanc004]] ([[User talk:Myanc004|talk]]) 19:27, 14 September 2008 (UTC) == Copyright problems with [[:Image:Bockingfloyd.jpg|Image:Bockingfloyd.jpg]] == {{mbox|type=warning|msg= Thank you for uploading [[:Image:Bockingfloyd.jpg|Image:Bockingfloyd.jpg]]. However it is missing information needed for compliance with [[w:copyright|copyright law]] and Wikibooks' [[WB:MEDIA|media policy]]. This and other files you have uploaded may soon be deleted unless the '''copyright permissions''' and '''source''' can be determined. If you know this information, then please add the correct [[WB:ICT|templates]] to the [[:Image:Image:Bockingfloyd.jpg|description page]] with the copyright and source information included; there is no need to upload it again. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me, or ask in the [[WB:HELP|assistance reading room]]. See {{UserImages}} for a complete list of your uploads which may get deleted soon.
Thank you.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 18:50, 17 October 2008 (UTC)}}

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Bdesh003!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |

* Please [[:w:Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on discussion pages by typing ~~~~ * If you're coming here from Wikipedia, you should read [[WB:WFW|our primer for Wikipedians]] to get up-to-speed quickly. * '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

* Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 03:14, 10 September 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I think that's so cool that you have a twin! My girlfriend is a twin as well; and as far as education goes I full heartidly beileve in equal opportunity for everyone! Hi Brittney! First off, I too am a ice cream lover (preferably chocolate) and I find it very hard to resist it either! I also believe you made some wonderful points in your educational philosophy. Being able to actually "reach" your students and challenge them to learn even more is very important. Some of my most influential teachers were in elementary school and were the ones who actually set the foundation of my education. So in return, I also agree with your statement that you definitely have the opportunity to make a profound impact on a child's life. Whether you encourage them to learn further or simply just teach them something new at that point in time, you are touching their life. Many people never take into account that everyone learns through different medias or styles either. I believe that teachers have the responsibility to help every child learn whether it may mean they have to use a different method than usual. You have some great beliefs and I believe that you will make a wonderful teacher. Good luck! [[User:Awade006|Awade006]] ([[User talk:Awade006|talk]]) 02:21, 13 September 2008 (UTC) I agree with your teaching philosophy that a teacher needs to be flexible to their students' needs. You also make a good point about challenging students. I think that many times people get stuck on the idea that children can only learn certain things, but many times by challenging them, they can achieve far beyond regular expectations because they didn't know that they couldn't or shouldn't be able to do something. You also hit on a key thing of helping children to attain their own inner drive. I enjoyed reading your teaching philosophy. [[User:Myanc004|Myanc004]] ([[User talk:Myanc004|talk]]) 02:37, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

revision.comment: Notification regarding [[:Image:Image-Me part bw.jpg]]. using [[User:Mike.lifeguard/Twinkle Speedy documentation|TW]]
revision.text:
[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Bbomb003!
Wow! I really like your page, it is so colorful. Congratulations on getting married and getting ready to have a baby. I am a mother of two and trust me it is the most rewarding thing you can do is to be a parent. I am pleased to read that you want to have a fun classroom and not just a lecture hall. I believe that you have a great attidude and personality to become a great teacher. Good luck with everything. [[User:Myoun027|Myoun027]] ([[User talk:Myoun027|talk]]) 19:49, 11 September 2008 (UTC) {| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |

You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing here and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' for the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything & it is really easy. Come say [[WB:HELP|hello]] to everyone!

Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

* Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 03:14, 10 September 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} My family are HUGE HOKIE FANS also!! I think my husband only owns tech t-shirts and no others. Its good to see a neighborly face, I live in Saltville, Virginia so not too far from you. I agree with your philosophy of education. Teachers do need to be positive role models and provide students with the very best education. [[User:Tkirk006|Tkirk006]] ([[User talk:Tkirk006|talk]]) 00:58, 12 September 2008 (UTC) Hey! I love your About the Author page! Congrats on preparing to become a father. My husband is also a big Hokies fan. I loved reading your teaching philosophy and I think we share alot of the same goals. Teaching is a hard job and you are right. Where would our doctors be without teachers ecouraging and preparing them? I also want to be that teacher the students remember when they look back. I want to make a difference just like you. I also like the way you picture your future classroom. Having students interact with one another and learn is so important. I think your future students are going to appreciate you and they are going to be so lucky to have you shape their lives. Good luck to you. :) [[User:Hgibb005|Hgibb005]] ([[User talk:Hgibb005|talk]]) 18:48, 12 September 2008 (UTC) Hi Ben! I enjoyed reading your Philosophy of Education and personal information. I admire your desire to make a difference, not only in your student's knowledge, but in their lives as well. I can hear your heart for students, which will benefit you and keep you motivated through the ups and downs of teaching. I would love to be able to speak into the lives of my students as well-- especially those who come from difficult family situations. I have seen my mom fulfill some of the hopes that you mentioned. She teaches 2nd grade and has students that come back to see her even after they have gone to high school. Some of them want to be teachers because of her. May your desires be fulfilled and you see students grow through your teaching and care! By the way, good job on using color in your About Me page ... and congratulations on your recent marriage and soon-to- be fatherhood![[User:Bapeters98|Bapeters98]] ([[User talk:Bapeters98|talk]]) 02:24, 15 September 2008 (UTC) == Copyright problems with [[:Image:Me part bw.jpg|Image:Me part bw.jpg]] == {{mbox|type=warning|msg= Thank you for uploading [[:Image:Me part bw.jpg|Image:Me part bw.jpg]]. However it is missing information needed for compliance with [[w:copyright|copyright law]] and Wikibooks' [[WB:MEDIA|media policy]]. This and other files you have uploaded may soon be deleted unless the '''copyright permissions''' and '''source''' can be determined. If you know this information, then please add the correct [[WB:ICT|templates]] to the [[:Image:Image:Me part bw.jpg|description page]] with the copyright and source information included; there is no need to upload it again. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me, or ask in the [[WB:HELP|assistance reading room]]. See {{UserImages}} for a complete list of your uploads which may get deleted soon.

Thank you.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 00:13, 27 October 2008 (UTC)}}

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Apark049!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} It's good to see another history major in this class. I am a history and social studies major and would like to teach high school history. Looks like we are also both juniors at ODU, although I did not go to TCC, but still pretty similar. I agree with your philosophy on education in that it is very important and that students need to be active in participating in class. Our future, as a society, relies on the education of our youth and that is why it is very important we as teachers do what we can to help teach and educate students. [[User:Kcros007|Kcros007]] ([[User talk:Kcros007|talk]]) 18:40, 12 September 2008 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Ckest001!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |

Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!

Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 03:15, 10 September 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hi, Crystal. I completely agree with you that all students deserve the chance to succeed along with support. I too feel that if they are given the chance, they can accomplish anything, even things that they did not think were possible. [[User:Tande028|Tande028]] ([[User talk:Tande028|talk]]) 15:17, 13 September 2008 (UTC) Hi Crystal. I enjoyed your "about the author" submission because you put it so simply and wisely! I agree that we are all students - we continue learning our entire lives and to be a really good teacher, we need to always be observing and open to learning new things. Especially when our world is changing at such an incredible rate! I also agree with what you said about students learning in different ways and feeling that it's part of your job to teach "all students" - regardless of how they learn best. This means a lot of innovation and flexibilty are essential for teachers to be successful. I appreciate your positive, pro-active approach and philosophy! Thank you for sharing! [[User:Cstanton|Cstanton]] ([[User talk:Cstanton|talk]]) 19:39, 13 September 2008 (UTC) Hello Crystal. I too am a huge animal lover. At the moment I have four dogs, two cats, a horse and some chickens and a few goats! What struck me most about your page is how you said that we are all students! It is important for us to give to the students what we want and had wanted in a teacher back when we were in high school. I hope you have a wonderful school year! [[User:Sscho004|Sscho004]] ([[User talk:Sscho004|talk]]) 23:32, 14 September 2008 (UTC) What up Crystal!! I enjoy reading about you and your educational beliefs. I agree also with learning never stop and throughout are lives we contuine to learn. AS: I also enjoy having animals, because I love my 190 pound Akita . [[User:Pjack020|Pjack020]] ([[User talk:Pjack020|talk]]) 08:59, 7 December 2008 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Cpenr002!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |
[[Image:Crystal Clear app korganizer.png|20px]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing here and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' for the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything & it is really easy. Come say [[WB:HELP|hello]] to everyone!
[[Image:Icon apps query.svg|20px]] '''Getting help'''
* You can always get help from the community in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * If something you wrote was tagged with {{tlx|query}}, and you think this was done in error, just remove it & explain why on the talk page. * If your upload was tagged with {{tlx|nld}}, {{tlx|bfu}}, or {{tlx|nfur}}, please read the template message as it explains the violation of [[WB:MEDIA|our media policy]]. Please be sure to provide the required {{tlx|information}}: a [[WB:ICT|license tag]] & source are always required; fair use images require a {{tlx|fair use rationale}}. | style="padding:0em 0.5em 0em 0.5em;" | | style="width:55%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #abd5f5; background-color:#f1f5fc;" |
[[Image:Transmission icon.png|20px]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please [[:w:Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on discussion pages by typing ~~~~ * If you're coming here from Wikipedia, you should read [[WB:WFW|our primer for Wikipedians]] to get up-to-speed quickly. * '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[Image:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 03:15, 10 September 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hey Christina, I agree with you that there should be equal opportunities to learn. I do have to disagree with you, however, on your position on private schools- I attended a private school and my family has been far from wealthy. I went to private school on tuition assistance because my parents thought it would be a better education for me than the public schools in that area. Almost every person I know who went to that school had some form of tuition assistance and many were normal middle class and lower class people. That being said, I agree with you about class size! Smaller classes are definitely better for any age group when it comes to learning. Good luck with the math degree-you're a much braver soul than I am!! :) [[User:Rcole020|Rcole020]] ([[User talk:Rcole020|talk]]) 20:58, 11 September 2008 (UTC) == Copyright problems with [[:Image:Pics 016 small.jpg|Image:Pics 016 small.jpg]] == {{mbox|type=warning|msg= Thank you for uploading [[:Image:Pics 016 small.jpg|Image:Pics 016 small.jpg]]. However it is missing information needed for compliance with [[w:copyright|copyright law]] and Wikibooks' [[WB:MEDIA|media policy]]. This and other files you have uploaded may soon be deleted unless the '''copyright permissions''' and '''source''' can be determined. If you know this information, then please add the correct [[WB:ICT|templates]] to the [[:Image:Image:Pics 016 small.jpg|description page]] with the copyright and source information included; there is no need to upload it again. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me, or ask in the [[WB:HELP|assistance reading room]]. See {{UserImages}} for a complete list of your uploads which may get deleted soon.
Thank you.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 18:44, 17 October 2008 (UTC)}}

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I am so stoked to find someone else who is pretty much on the same path as me. History/Social Sciences major and not graduating on time and I came to college, not this one, in 2005. I agree about making history fun. I had a teacher who did and inspired me to follow in his footsteps. Your family history is really interesting. My parents traced ours a few years back, but eeing what you found has inspired me to look into it myself. I figure as a History Major I could do better than the did. [[User:Mhama001|Mhama001]] ([[User talk:Mhama001|talk]]) 01:35, 15 September 2008 (UTC)

revision.comment: Notification regarding [[:Image:My Images.jpg]]. using [[User:Mike.lifeguard/Twinkle Speedy documentation|TW]]
revision.text:
Hi Erica! We are kind of in the same place, I'm 23 and a first year undergraduate at ODU. I want to teach younger children though. I am a leader at my church right now for 6th-8th graders and it is very challenging. A lot of the kids are very negative. I used to lead 1st graders which is much easier. How are you able to connect so well with the middle ages of kids? I feel like there is this huge gab sometimes. i think it is awesome that you want to bring a very positive environment to kids, especially respect for one another. I find my kids tend to put each other down and think less of themselves, and they seem surprised when I tell them otherwise. We need more teachers in the world that will believe in children and their abilities. [[User:Lairangel7|Lairangel7]] ([[User talk:Lairangel7|talk]]) 18:41, 14 September 2008 (UTC) Hello there Erica. That is pretty cool that you can connect with 5th graders. I hope to teach middle school age as well because I feel like I can connect with them too. I really like that you believe that any kid can do whatever they want. That is a quality that makes a great and successful teacher. It is nice that you will use your past history in church to teach some of the ideas of Christianity. Good luck with the rest of the semester and can not wait to read your articles. [[User:Rreev002|Rreev002]] ([[User talk:Rreev002|talk]]) 23:43, 14 September 2008 (UTC) Thank your for responding to my page. I was misunderstood however. I did not live in Alaska. My husband was just stationed there a year ago and I decided to stay here and finish school while he is there. I will be visiting there next summer and am very excited to see what it is like there.[[User:BCollier|BCollier]] ([[User talk:BCollier|talk]]) 01:41, 15 September 2008 (UTC)

Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) I am intrigued by the practice of "allowing students to teach" as a "method that shows how well the objective has been mastered." Empathy is one objective that I associate with students teaching their fellow classmates. I also believe that it helps foster an appreciation for what each child brings to the group, and creates a sense of community. I hadn't, however, considered using this as a means of assessment. Thanks for sharing this great idea! [[User:Krobi036|Krobi036]] ([[User talk:Krobi036|talk]]) 15:27, 11 September 2008 (UTC) |}

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I really agree with your idea that parents are the first teachers. It is very hard to teach a student, when the parents do not care at all. It seems as though homework would rarely ever get done, they would not be motivated very much, and their attitudes would be poor. Overall it makes it better for every if the teacher and the parent work together for the future of the student. [[User:Bdavi038|Bdavi038]] ([[User talk:Bdavi038|talk]]) 02:01, 15 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} hey vivian. I would just like to say I loved your teaching philosphy. I guess sometimes being a younger student it is easy to get wrapped up in the romance of being a teacher. Films like Dead Poet's Society and all :P But I do agree that a teach with good control and structure is vital as well as equal treatment of students. [[User:Rhatchel|Rhatchel]] ([[User talk:Rhatchel|talk]]) 19:32, 14 September 2008 (UTC) Hi Vivian, I see that you were trying to do a peer review on my page but you did my feed back to the other student you may want to go back, because it won't show that you did one. [[User:Tfrat001|Tfrat001]] ([[User talk:Tfrat001|talk]]) 03:46, 30 September 2008 (UTC) == Copyright problems with [[:Image:Familia Lane-Hoyle.JPG|Image:Familia Lane-Hoyle.JPG]] == {{mbox|type=warning|msg= Thank you for uploading [[:Image:Familia Lane-Hoyle.JPG|Image:Familia Lane-Hoyle.JPG]]. However it is missing information needed for compliance with [[w:copyright|copyright law]] and Wikibooks' [[WB:MEDIA|media policy]]. This and other files you have uploaded may soon be deleted unless the '''copyright permissions''' and '''source''' can be determined. If you know this information, then please add the correct [[WB:ICT|templates]] to the [[:Image:Image:Familia Lane-Hoyle.JPG|description page]] with the copyright and source information included; there is no need to upload it again. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me, or ask in the [[WB:HELP|assistance reading room]]. See {{UserImages}} for a complete list of your uploads which may get deleted soon.
Thank you.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 18:42, 17 October 2008 (UTC)}}

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hey! I agree with your teaching philosophy. You have made some very good points about how important it is for teachers to have a positive influence toward their students. It is a reality that their will be times when we, as teachers, will not have enough time to be invloved with every single student. There are alot of factors involved like tests, deadlines, etc. that just make it impossible to do everything we want to do. Eventhough we are teachers, we are still one person. That is why it is so important to make every second count. Teachers do wear many hats and that is why we can be so much more than a "teacher" to our students. Good luck to you. :) [[User:Hgibb005|Hgibb005]] ([[User talk:Hgibb005|talk]]) 18:59, 12 September 2008 (UTC) I like how you pointed out that teachers have to be more than just fact producers. Teachers have many pairs of shoes to fill when it comes to getting through to students. Not only will it be our jobs to get the essentials taught, but real life lessons in diversity and self worth. We definitely have our work cut out for us. Heidi [[User:Hlame001|Hlame001]] ([[User talk:Hlame001|talk]]) 13:21, 14 September 2008 (UTC) I agree with your teaching philosophy. Teachers have to be able to multi-task on a daily basis and it is a challenge especially when you consider the diverse learning styles and the push for schools to perform well on the Standards of Learning Tests. But I agree wholeheartedly that each student has the right to an education. Now if we can just get the students themselves to realize that fact, we'll have accomplished something in our teaching careers.[[User:Lpaul006|Lpaul006]] ([[User talk:Lpaul006|talk]]) 15:42, 18 November 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hi, my name is Robert and I have lived in several countries too. Germany for one year and Japan for three. I have also lived in or visited most of the states. I'm a little older than most of the students,52, I'm retiring soon and want to get into elementary education. You seem to enjoy your job. I can only hope I can do as well. My son is a geologist living in Houston Texas. We are hoping that He does not get washed away with hurricane Ike coming today and Saturday. Nice talking to you. [[User:Rkilb001|Rkilb001]] ([[User talk:Rkilb001|talk]]) 14:06, 12 September 2008 (UTC) Hi, this is Heidi. I have two children as well 13 and 9. It really sounds like you love your job and your students. I hope to be there soon. I have always wanted to teach. I remember when my sisters and I were young, we would play school for entertainment. I would be the teacher and hand out papers to my class. It is a memory that keeps me going. [[User:Hlame001|Hlame001]] ([[User talk:Hlame001|talk]]) 13:15, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Wow Rhonda, it sounds like you are really busy! I can't imagine having 2 daughters in high school, working full time and taking classes, my hats off to you. It's cool that you are working in the school system educating kids on drugs and safety, these issues are particularly important in this age and time. Good luck with your studies. [[User:Cweek006|Cweek006]] ([[User talk:Cweek006|talk]]) 00:15, 13 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hi, you begin your article talking about teacher enthusiasm and interest in the various subjects, which carries over to the kids. In my opinion these traits are essential, as children who are interested in learning make much better students. Recognizing that students learn differently is also important, and trying different teaching styles to try to reach them greatly impoves their chances of learning to the best of their ability, especially with ADD kids. I also believe inclusion is important, however it should be done in such a way that doesn't detract from the rest of the class learning. Having a warm, inviting, comfortable classroom will also enrich the student's learning experience, as they will enjoy being in the class. For the kids who don't have this at home, the classroom becomes a lifeline. Additionally, teaching good citizenship, anti-bullying, and respect reinforces what has hopefully been taught at home, and carries into adulthood. Trying to instill a love of learning is what each teacher should be aiming for. By doing this, one has succeeded mightly. Finally, parental involvement is crucial, especially with children that need a tailored curriculum. This improves the chances of the student doing well in school. I really liked your article. It's obivous you put a HUGE amount of thought into your teaching philsophy. Any student who has you for a teacher will be fortunate![[User:Dcask002|Dcask002]] ([[User talk:Dcask002|talk]]) 17:43, 11 September 2008 (UTC) Amanda, It was great reading a little bit about your past! I think it is such a great thing that you want to work with special education students! I could not agree more that the public education system needs more high quality effective teachers! I can't believe that you can manage school with two small children, you must have your hands full! I agree that a positive attitude is something that makes a effective teacher! I enjoyed reading your philosophy section and I could relate thoroughly! Good Luck with the course and with your future in teaching![[User:Wkent279|Wkent279]] ([[User talk:Wkent279|talk]]) 21:22, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Heya Amy! Congratulations on your choice in getting into teaching. If you love kids and having a career that rewards more than a paycheck, then you have made the right choice. I am very excited for you and I wish you the best in your career. I believe that future teachers like you and I are a part of a change in how the education system is run. There are so many different tools available for students now and we must adapt to their needs and learning capabilities. Like you said, teachers need to realize that the responsibility of learning is as much if not more on the instructor as on the student. Cheers! [[User:Aburd004|Aburd004]] ([[User talk:Aburd004|talk]]) 00:55, 15 September 2008 (UTC) I thought you had some very good points about being a successful teacher. Goals are definitely very important. You have to set new goals for yourself so that you can constantly excel and become better at teaching. I think a variety of different teaching methods are also a great idea. It's good to expose students to different ways of learning. It keeps the class from being boring. Good luck! [[User:Pmoral1|Pmoral1]] ([[User talk:Pmoral1|talk]]) 03:28, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

[http://prc-tools.sourceforge.net/ PRC-Tools] can be used to [[w:Cross-compile|cross compile]] Palm OS software on UN*X compatible systems such as Linux, BSD and Cygwin.
== installation ==
=== installing Palm OS SDKs (development material) on Linux ===
Source a Palm OS SDK and place it in <tt>/tmp</tt>, then:
cd /usr/local/share sudo tar xzf /tmp/palmos-sdk-5.0r3-1.tar.gz sudo mv sdk-5r3 palmdev
=== installing PRC-Tools on Debian Lenny ===
Should you find that <tt>prc-tools</tt> is not packaged for Lenny:
cd /tmp wget http://ftp.gnome.org/mirror/cdimage/snapshot/Debian/pool/main/p/prc-tools/prc-tools-arm_2.2.90.cvs20030306-6_i386.deb wget http://ftp.gnome.org/mirror/cdimage/snapshot/Debian/pool/main/p/prc-tools/prc-tools-doc_2.2.90.cvs20030306-6_all.deb wget http://ftp.gnome.org/mirror/cdimage/snapshot/Debian/pool/main/p/prc-tools/prc-tools-m68k_2.2.90.cvs20030306-6_i386.deb wget http://ftp.gnome.org/mirror/cdimage/snapshot/Debian/pool/main/p/prc-tools/prc-tools-utils_2.2.90.cvs20030306-6_i386.deb wget http://ftp.gnome.org/mirror/cdimage/snapshot/Debian/pool/main/p/prc-tools/prc-tools_2.2.90.cvs20030306-6_all.deb sudo apt-get install libstdc++5 sudo dpkg -i *.deb
=== testing PRC-Tools with Hello World ===
Create a file called <tt>[[../C/HelloWorld|HelloWorld.c]]</tt>, then:
m68k-palmos-gcc HelloWorld.c -o hello m68k-palmos-obj-res hello build-prc Hello.prc "Hello" HELO *.hello.grc
Although a [[/HelloWorldMakefile|Makefile]] makes for less typing.
== debugging with GDB ==
# build with the <tt>-g</tt> and <tt>-O0</tt> options # <tt>m68k-palmos-gdb App</tt> (where <tt>App</tt> is the object code fed into <tt>build-prc</tt>) # <tt>target pilot localhost:6414</tt> # start the app on POSE

#include 

UInt32 PilotMain( UInt16 cmd, void *cmdPBP, UInt16 launchFlags)
{
  EventType  event;
  char       *message = "Hello, world!";

  if ( sysAppLaunchCmdNormalLaunch == cmd)
  {
    WinDrawChars( message, StrLen(message), 55, 74 );

    do {
      EvtGetEvent( &event, evtWaitForever);

      SysHandleEvent( &event);

    } while (event.eType != appStopEvent);
  }

  return 0;
}
[[Category:{{FULLBOOKNAME}}|{{FULLCHAPTERNAME}}]]

revision.comment: [[Cascanding Style Sheets/Print version]] moved to [[Cascading Style Sheets/Print version]]: Typo
revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Cascading Style Sheets/Print version]]

PROJECT=Hello
CREATOR_ID=HELO

.SILENT:

all: $(PROJECT)

$(PROJECT): HelloWorld.c
	m68k-palmos-gcc HelloWorld.c -o $(PROJECT)
	m68k-palmos-obj-res $(PROJECT)
	build-prc $(PROJECT).prc "$(PROJECT)" $(CREATOR_ID) *.$(PROJECT).grc
	rm *.$(PROJECT).grc
	rm $(PROJECT)

clean:
	rm -f $(PROJECT).prc
[[Category:Programming for Palm OS|HelloWorldMakefile]]

revision.comment: New page: Honestly, does this really need to be completely neutral? I was struck by the absolute perfection of the tone, and the relevance and accuracy of the subject matter. This told me everything...
revision.text:
Honestly, does this really need to be completely neutral? I was struck by the absolute perfection of the tone, and the relevance and accuracy of the subject matter. This told me everything I needed to know about the subject when I knowing was vital. This isn't Wikipedia, these are Wikibooks. Books are written by authors, and have a specific tone to them. Any anyway, how can you be neutral about relationships?
- Rhodri

{{Editor note|This is a central place for collecting things to do, in this book. Further todos are scattered accross the book, in yellow boxes similar to this one. --[[User:Dan Polansky|Dan Polansky]] ([[User talk:Dan Polansky|talk]]) 09:54, 10 September 2008 (UTC)}}
==To do==
* In all examples of CSS code, replace all <nowiki><pre></nowiki> with <nowiki><source lang="CSS"></nowiki>. --[[User:Dan Polansky|Dan Polansky]] ([[User talk:Dan Polansky|talk]]) 09:54, 10 September 2008 (UTC) * In alphabetical index, link to individual sections of pages using "#", instead of only to the top of the page. --[[User:Dan Polansky|Dan Polansky]] ([[User talk:Dan Polansky|talk]]) 10:22, 10 September 2008 (UTC) * Add a section or chapter on various CSS versions or levels such as CSS1, CSS2, CSS2.1 and CSS3, including the overview of major changes, years of introduction and browser support. See also [[W:Css#Variations]]. Carefully pick from among the terms "version", "level", "variation" or "variant". --[[User:Dan Polansky|Dan Polansky]] ([[User talk:Dan Polansky|talk]]) 10:04, 20 April 2009 (UTC)

This is a glossary of the book, a list of keywords with definitions. {{CompactTOC}} ==D== ; [[../Defining|declaration]]: One of the parts a CSS rule located in the curly brackets and separated by a semicolon, such as "font-weight: bold" in "span { font-weight: bold; background: yellow; }". ==E== ; element : A part of a document starting with an opening tag and ending with a closing tag, such as "

keyword is important

". ==P== {{todo|Define property.}} ==R== ; rule : A string consisting of a selector, the "{" character, style specification, and the "}" character, such as "p { color: green; }". ==S== ; selector : The part of a CSS rule before the first "{". ; shorthand property : A CSS property that enables the setting of multiple properties as once, such as "border" as contrasts to non-shorthand properties "border-style" and "border-width". ==T== ; tag : The opening and closing sequence of characters of an element, such as "

" or "

". To be distinguished from ''element''. ==U== ; user agent : The client application such as a web browser used with a particular network protocol, such as http: or ftp:. [[Category:Cascading Style Sheets]]

[[Category:Inkscape]]

{{recipe}} To serve 4/6
== Ingredients for a small portion ==
*About 500 ml long simmered tomato meat sauce made with a soffritto of half an onion finely diced softened in a a little oil with 50 g diced bacon, to which you add 2 small minced garlic cloves and 2 tbsp tomato paste, then 250 g minced beef or beef and pork, and finally a tin of peeled plum tomatoes and their juices *400 g uncooked long grain rice *800 ml water *120 g grated Parmigiano-Reggiano or Peppercorn Pecorino or mature Cheddar + 1 heaped tbsp to finish * 2 eggs * Salt and pepper to taste
Optional Extras: *You can mix in large pieces of 1 or 2 chopped hard boiled eggs *You may season with ground allspice as well as salt and pepper *If you don't use the sweet spice you may add saffron strands (warmed briefly in a dry pan then crumbled and soaked in an espresso size cup of hot water) to colour and flavour the cooking water
== Procedure ==
# Pre-heat the oven to 180 C # Butter a Terracotta, Pyrex or aluminium dish - rectangular is traditional but not obligatory. # Rinse the greased dish in water and shake out excess # Whisk one egg lightly in a small bowl with a fork # Place the rice, the meat sauce and the 120 g of grated cheese in the dish along with the beaten egg and the water. Season lightly and mix gently but thoroughly # Bake for 30 minutes then remove from the oven and stir. ''Note - At this point the rice should be nearly cooked but there should be enough liquid left to complete the cooking. If it seems to be have dried out too much, add more water before stirring'' # Mix the remaining egg with the remaining cheese and distribute over the top # Return to the oven and bake a further 30 / 40 minutes or until well browned and firm on top. The water should have been fully absorbed and the texture should be firm but moist under the topping.
Best eaten warm but also delicious cold when the "Ross il-Forn" can be cut into squares and wrapped in cooking foil for eating on the beach or to take on a picnic. Very small squares make good party finger food if placed in paper cups or skewered with toothpicks.

revision.text: #REDIRECT [[Inkscape/Print version]]

I completely agree that with advances in technology the class romm is inevitably going to be altered and the way that we as teachers function in a classroom. By learning about the different technologies available for educational purposes and apply them to the way we teach, our students will be able to grow and learn more quickly. And also I feel that this way of teaching provides a better visual learning experience for all. [[User:Ascha006|Ascha006]] ([[User talk:Ascha006|talk]]) 18:49, 12 September 2008 (UTC)
Hello Pam,
Sounds like youve dedicated a lot of time to ballet. I admire that. I am, and always have been a huge fan of the arts (regardless of its contentious definition). And I see that you have two sons. Arent boys the greatest? I have been blessed with three boys. Your sons are a lot older than my sons though. My boys are 4, 2 and 2 months. And Magnum, I cant forget about him. Judging from your smile, I can tell you two have a great relationship (he must be the best owner anyone could have). In regards to your life goals and philosophies, I think its wonderful that you were open-minded enough to learn something from the children. I also strongly support you uninhibited confidence philosophy. I have always felt that this was a necessity for true success in any area of life. I enjoyed reading your user page. Sounds like you have a wonderful family and lead a very productive life. [[User:Abibb001|Abibb001]] ([[User talk:Abibb001|talk]]) 02:29, 15 September 2008 (UTC)
Hi, Pam!
I can see that dancing has certainly played a major and impressive part of your busy life! That's wonderful! My daughter was heavily involved with dance from first grade all the way through high school (this, of course, qualifies <u>me</u> as the honorable, ever-present and ready-to-go "Backstage Mom"!). That is a good phrase you have used: uninhibited confidence--I like that! And you are right about the difference it will make with children as they grow through their educational years; they MUST be able to believe in themselves and we teachers play an unbelievably vital role in perpetuating their self-images. I believe you will be the kind of teacher they will need (and love, too!).[[User:Riddle00579942marie|Riddle00579942marie]] ([[User talk:Riddle00579942marie|talk]]) 18:24, 20 September 2008 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Delsorbo11!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |
[[Image:Crystal Clear app korganizer.png|20px]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing here and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' for the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything & it is really easy. Come say [[WB:HELP|hello]] to everyone!
[[Image:Icon apps query.svg|20px]] '''Getting help'''
* You can always get help from the community in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * If something you wrote was tagged with {{tlx|query}}, and you think this was done in error, just remove it & explain why on the talk page. * If your upload was tagged with {{tlx|nld}}, {{tlx|bfu}}, or {{tlx|nfur}}, please read the template message as it explains the violation of [[WB:MEDIA|our media policy]]. Please be sure to provide the required {{tlx|information}}: a [[WB:ICT|license tag]] & source are always required; fair use images require a {{tlx|fair use rationale}}. | style="padding:0em 0.5em 0em 0.5em;" | | style="width:55%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #abd5f5; background-color:#f1f5fc;" |
[[Image:Transmission icon.png|20px]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please [[:w:Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on discussion pages by typing ~~~~ * If you're coming here from Wikipedia, you should read [[WB:WFW|our primer for Wikipedians]] to get up-to-speed quickly. * '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[Image:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks [[User:AdRiley|AdRiley]] ([[User talk:AdRiley|talk]]) 15:38, 10 September 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hey Kelli, Although I can't say I agree with your choice of football teams (GO SAINTS AND PATS!), I totally agree with your teaching philosophy. All too often, teachers do the same things over and over....which is the true definition of insanity according to Einstein. I also really like your quotes and I hope to use one of them in my own teachings. I certainly do hope that all teaches give something that students can take home besides homework. Good luck to you with your career! -Aaron [[User:Aburd004|Aburd004]] ([[User talk:Aburd004|talk]]) 23:38, 12 September 2008 (UTC)

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Swald004!

Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks [[User:AdRiley|AdRiley]] ([[User talk:AdRiley|talk]]) 15:38, 10 September 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} I think it's terrific that you recognize how difficult it can be to be a teacher and that one needs to be really dedicated to the profession in order to be successful. I also think that many teachers don't follow the philosophy that they should be respectful of their students. Too many teachers I had in the past did not respect us as students and therefore we did not respect them in return. Since you are someone who realizes how important respect is, I'm sure you won't have any problem earning your own students respect. [[User:Rwebe005|Rwebe005]] ([[User talk:Rwebe005|talk]]) 00:24, 12 September 2008 (UTC) Hey! First off, I just want to say, I am also addicted to food! There, I said it. haha. But in all seriousness, I think it is great that you realize how important it is to talk with the students, rather than "talking down" to them. I can tell you want respect from your students and the way to get that is to respect them! Not a lot of teachers understand that. I think if you keep doing that while you are teaching, you will have no problem creating a fun and meaningful learning experience for your students.[[User:Ssere001|Ssere001]] ([[User talk:Ssere001|talk]]) 06:00, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} Hi P'akka. Yes, it is good to find someone from around here. Hopefully we can help each other through this course. It is definitely to your advantage to have a job working as an assistant for a daycare. I work at Food Lion:) So, needless to say, I won't have the extra experience going in. I like your philosophy. If only more people would use it! I think sometimes too much focus is put on the wrong areas! Best wishes with the course...we'll need it;)[[User:Mrowl004|Mrowl004]] ([[User talk:Mrowl004|talk]]) 00:50, 14 September 2008 (UTC) It's good to see another person out their who shares my views on education! Since I plan on teaching history, I tend to think in a more factual and rational way when it comes to relaying information. In my opinion, much extraneous and unnecessary data can ruin a subject. [[User:Clins002|Clins002]] ([[User talk:Clins002|talk]]) 17:50, 14 September 2008 (UTC)

Hi, I really enjoyed reading your page and seeing your family. I too have a Bachelor's Degree and decided to come back to obtain licensure. I agree whole heartedly with your teaching philosophy. It is in our hands to be sure our chidren are raised with a proper education. I also wanted to say that I admire any woman attending college with a child, it is such a difficult task. Good luck to you! [[User:Jlhogan22|Jlhogan22]] ([[User talk:Jlhogan22|talk]]) 00:25, 14 September 2008 (UTC) Aww, your little boy is so cute! I totally agree with your philosophy, I just met my goddaughter (best friend's baby) and she showed me how amazing children are (even at only 4 months old). We definately have such an important responsibilty to these children, because if the parent or teacher falls through, then if the other doesn't pick it up, that child is lost with no direction. It definately starts with a personal responsibility to the education of each child. If we don't feel that, then we shouldn't be given that power over those kids. Kids need love first, and facts second. Life isn't facts, its touching people and surviving through the rest. [[User:Cpayn012|Cpayn012]] ([[User talk:Cpayn012|talk]]) 03:04, 15 September 2008 (UTC) == Copyright problems with [[:Image:Preschool pic.jpg|Image:Preschool pic.jpg]] == {{mbox|type=warning|msg= Thank you for uploading [[:Image:Preschool pic.jpg|Image:Preschool pic.jpg]]. If you know this information, then please add the correct [[WB:ICT|templates]] to the [[:Image:Image:Meanddenim.jpg|description page]] with the copyright and source information included; there is no need to upload it again. If you have any questions, feel free to contact me, or ask in the [[WB:HELP|assistance reading room]]. See {{UserImages}} for a complete list of your uploads which may get deleted soon.
Thank you.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 18:49, 17 October 2008 (UTC)}} :Please check the rest of your uploads too.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 18:49, 17 October 2008 (UTC)

== Background ==
This cookbook was created by Dan McCreary in the Spring of 2008. The XRX label was created by Dan soon after the December 2007 XTech meeting in Boston. Dan found many people there that all came to the same conclusion: using XForms and a native XML database offered some huge advantages. He also found that his related cookbook (the XForms cookbook) started to have many examples that used not just XForms but also XQuery as a back end. In order to keep the XForms cookbook general and still appeal XForms developers, many of the XForms/XQuery examples were migrated to this Wikibook.
Many XRX fans feel XRX to be a superior web application architecture, a natural consequence of XML being used both in the client, as a data transmission standard, and in the server.
We hope you find this book useful and we hope you contribute to the examples.
{{BookCat}}
----
